question: Which of the following tests is used to diagnose benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV)?
Which of the following organisms most commonly causes acute suppurative otitis media (ASOM)?
Which of the following types of tympanogram is seen in glue ear?
Which of the following investigations is used to differentiate cochlear from retrocochlear hearing loss?

A teenager is brought to the clinic after having hurt himself during a rugby match at school. Examination reveals a fluctuant swelling on his left pinna, where he was hit by the ball. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most likely cause of perforation of the bony part of the nasal septum?
Which test involves applying pressure to the external auditory canal to induce nystagmus?
Which of the following is the most common presentation of nasopharyngeal cancer?
A young woman comes to the clinic with the complaint of intermittent episodes of vertigo on turning her head to the left. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 24-year-old woman comes to the clinic with complaints of severe vertigo and hearing loss for 4 days. She reports having had a similar attack 1 year ago that resolved without medications. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 37-year-old man presents to the otorhinolaryngology clinic with the complaint of severe pain in his left ear. Examination reveals several vesicles on the tympanic membrane, meatal skin, and concha. What is the diagnosis?

A 9-year-old child is brought to your office with complaints of severe itching and pain in his right ear. Examination reveals a wet newspaper-like mass in the external ear. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A man with a history of chronic suppurative otitis media (CSOM) presents with complaints of severe retro-orbital pain, ear discharge, and diplopia on looking laterally. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 9-year-old boy had gotten into a fight 4 days ago. He has now developed bilateral nasal obstruction with pain and fever. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old woman presents to the office with the complaint of nasal obstruction. Examination reveals a foul smell from the nose as well as roomy nasal cavities with greenish crusts. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following investigations is always ordered in cases of chronic suppurative otitis media (CSOM)?

An 8-year-old child is brought to the physician by his parents with complaints of continuous, odorless, and sticky discharge from his left ear. Examination reveals a central perforation of the tympanic membrane. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient is found to have right ear subtotal perforation. Which of the following findings will be seen on tuning fork tests?

answers.option: False negative Rinne's for left ear

question: What is the extent of the parapharyngeal space?

answers.option: Base of the skull to the epiglottis
Base of skull to lower border of mandible
Base of the skull to the hyoid bone

question: What is the most common cause of Ludwig angina?
What is the most common cause of oroantral fistula formation?

A 40-year-old man presents with the complaint of a swelling on the gums for the past 9 months. It is a soft, smooth, reddish mass that bleeds on touch. He uses a hard toothbrush. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the gold standard investigation for the diagnosis of sleep apnea?

answers.option: Lateral soft tissue X-ray of neck

question: A 65-year-old man with a 10-pack-years of smoking history is diagnosed with glottic cancer. Fiber optic direct laryngoscopy (FODL) reveals exophytic growths on both the vocal cords. The vocal cords are mobile. There is no nodal involvement. How will this tumor be classified according to the TNM classification system?
A newborn is brought to the clinic with the complaint of breathing difficulty. Examination reveals floppy aryepiglottic folds and prominent arytenoids. What is the most probable diagnosis?
What is the incision on the tympanic membrane called?
Frequency and loudness are two properties of sound. Frequency is measured in hertz (Hz). Which of the following frequency ranges most accurately represents the audible frequency for a human being?

A 62-year-old male suffering from glottic squamous cell carcinoma comes to your clinic. Fiber optic direct laryngoscopy (FODL) reveals an exophytic growth on the right vocal cord. The right vocal cord is also fixed and immobile. Lymph nodes of the neck are not palpable. What is the tumor stage based on these findings?

A 36-year-old female presents to her primary care physician with a complaint of difficulty in opening her mouth for the last 6 months. She has a history of chewing betel nuts for the last 10 years. Examination reveals generalized pale mucosa and fibrosis in the oral cavity with angular cheilitis. She does not have cervical lymphadenopathy. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 24-year-old man presents to the clinic with complaints of severe itching and pain in his right ear. He also complains of pain while opening the mouth. Examination reveals a furuncle located anteriorly on the external auditory canal. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism?
Which of the following fractures is associated with craniofacial dissociation?
Which of the following facial fractures is characterized by step deformity of the infraorbital margin?
'Hot potato voice' is seen in which of the following conditions?

A 10-year-old boy is brought to the clinic because of a 1-week history of pain while swallowing and decreased mouth opening. The boy also has an ongoing dental infection. Oral examination reveals that the tongue is lifted upwards and backward. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old woman undergoes a subtotal thyroidectomy. On her fourth postoperative day, her voice appears to be weak and she is unable tor raise her pitch. Laryngeal examination reveals that the right vocal cord is shortened and the glottis is askew. Which of the following nerve injuries is the most likely cause?

answers.option: Combined superior laryngeal and recurrent laryngeal nerve injury

question: A 50-year-old man presents to the clinic because of a 2-month history of hoarseness. He has a 10 pack-year history of smoking. Fiberoptic laryngoscopy reveals a horseshoe-shaped ulcerative mass on both vocal cords with normal vocal cord mobility. What is the stage of the tumor?
Which disease is the result of obstruction of the glands on the floor of the mouth?
Which of the following is the site of the antral lavage or proof puncture?
Where is the sinus of Morgagni located?

answers.option: Between the skull base and the apex of the hyoid bone
Between the hyoid bone and the floor of the mouth
Between the thyropharyngeus and the cricopharyngeus
Between the skull base and the superior constrictor
Between the palatoglossal arch and the palatopharyngeal arch

question: A 4-year-old girl is brought into the clinic by her mother with the complaint of bilateral hearing loss for the last 6 months. She has also been snoring at night. Otoscopy reveals fluid level with air bubbles in both ears along with dull, bluish, and retracted tympanic membranes. What is the most likely diagnosis of this patient?

answers.option: Safe type chronic suppurative otitis media

question: A 17-year-old boy is brought to the clinic for the evaluation of recurrent epistaxis and nasal obstruction. Examination reveals a lobulated mass obstructing the left concha. Which of the following is the investigation of choice for this condition?

answers.option: Soft tissue lateral radiograph of nasopharynx
CT scan of the head with contrast

question: Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for a T3 tumor of the larynx without nodal involvement?

A 35-year-old man comes to the clinic with the complaint of sweating over the preauricular sinus whenever he chews food. Several months ago, he had undergone a surgery. Which of the following surgical procedures is most likely to have resulted in this complication?

A 26-year-old man is having lunch with his friend at a Chinese restaurant when his face suddenly turns blue. He is having trouble breathing and is unable to speak. Which of the following is the most appropriate first-aid management?
A myringotomy is to be performed in an individual with acute suppurative otitis media. Where should the incision be given in the tympanic membrane?
Which of the following is not a component of the middle ear cleft?
Which of the following structures forms part of the nasal septum?
Which of the following surgical approaches is used to reach the frontal sinus in chronic sinusitis?
Which of the following is true regarding mucoepidermoid carcinoma?

answers.option: Greater the epidermoid component, the more malignant the tumor
It is treated by radical parotidectomy
Greater the mucoid component, the more malignant the tumor
It is more aggressive in major salivary glands
It is aggressive and highly metastatic

question: Which of the following are the parts of the hypopharynx?

answers.option: Precricoid region, posterior pharyngeal wall, pyriform fossa
Postcricoid region, posterior pharyngeal wall, pyriform fossa
Precricoid region, posterior pharyngeal wall, pyriform fossa and posterior 1/3rd tongue
Postcricoid region, posterior pharyngeal wall, pyriform fossa and posterior 1/3rd tongue

question: A neonate of one day of age has recurrent cyanosis and breathing difficulty. A mucoid discharge is noted inside the nasal cavity. Doctors suspect an upper respiratory tract infection, but there is no stridor or fever. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A school van driver presents to the clinic with a 4-month history of paroxysmal sneezing, runny nose, and watery eyes, precipitated by smoke and dust. A diagnosis of allergic rhinitis is made. Which antihistamine would be best for him?
In noise-induced hearing loss, a typical frequency dip occurs at which of the following frequencies?
Which of the following is the primary aim of the surgery in chronic suppurative otitis media?
Which of the following nerves pass through the internal acoustic meatus?
Which is true regarding pre-malignant lesions of the oral cavity?

answers.option: Leukoplakia is a red erythematous patch
Leukoplakia is more malignant than erythroplakia
Lateral border of tongue is the most common involved site in erythroplakia
Erythroplakia is more common in males
Erythroplakia is 17 times more malignant than leukoplakia

question: A 12-year-old girl is brought to the clinic with complaints of sore throat, coughs, low-grade fever, and malaise for 5 days. Upon general inspection, the child looks ill and lethargic. Vital signs show a temperature of 101 °F (37 °C), a heart rate of 88 beats per minute, and a thready pulse. Oral and throat examinations revealed a thick grey membrane adherent on the faucial tonsils and soft palate. A tongue depressor is used to scrape this membrane resulting in bleeding. Lymph nodes in the jugulodigastric region are palpable. A throat swab is taken and sent for culture. What is the best step in the management of this child's condition?

answers.option: Hospitalization, IV fluids, antitoxin, and emergency tonsillectomy

question: A trumpet player presents with hoarseness and a swelling in the neck which increases in size on coughing and on performing the Valsalva maneuver. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Killian's dehiscence is a potential weak space for the formation of the pharyngeal pouch. Where is it found?

answers.option: Between the base of the skull and the superior constrictor muscle
Between the upper and lower borders of the cricoid lamina
Between the palatoglossal and palatopharyngeal arches
Between the glottic and epiglottic folds
Between the thyropharyngeus and cricopharyngeus muscles

question: A 40-year-old man has a cystic, fluctuant mass of bluish color on the inner side of his lower lip. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

An 18-year-old boy presents to the emergency room bleeding profusely from the front of his nose. Bleeding does not stop on pinching the nose for five minutes. The site of the bleed cannot be localized. Which of the following should be the next step in management?
The endolymph is rich in which of the following ions?
A 45-year-old woman who was previously diagnosed with iron deficiency anemia now complains of difficulty in swallowing. What is the most probably diagnosis?

A 65-year-old woman comes to the clinic with a 2-month history of difficulty in swallowing after taking 2-3 bites. She also complains of hearing a gurgling sound on swallowing and regurgitation of food contents at night. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A barium swallow study is used for the evaluation of which of the following conditions?
Which of the following structures forms the promontory in the middle ear cavity?
What is the normal constituent of the mastoid antrum?
A 16-year-old boy is brought to the clinic for the evaluation of recurrent, bilateral profuse epistaxis and nasal obstruction. There is no history of recent trauma. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old Caucasian woman comes to the clinic for evaluation of bilateral, conductive, complete deafness, which started as decreased hearing a year ago and got worse during her pregnancy. There is no history of ear discharge, but she complains of ringing in the ears occasionally. Her brother has also suffered from the same problem for 3 years. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most common cause of acute follicular tonsillitis?
Which of the following is true regarding sinonasal polyps?

answers.option: Allergy may cause an antrochoanal polyp
Ethmoidal polyp are multiple and bilateral
Caldwell-Luc's operation is used to treat them
Ethmoidal polyp are common in children

question: Which of the following is the gold standard investigation for detecting the site of defect in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) rhinorrhea?
Which of the following is not true regarding the bony labyrinth?

answers.option: It contains three compartments; scala vestibuli, scala media, and scala tympani
Three semicircular canals open into the vestibule by five openings
Bony cochlea winds around pyramid of bone called modiolus
It consists of the vestibule, the semicircular canals and the cochlea

question: Which of the following instruments can be used for the removal of a foreign body from the nose?

A 60-year-old man presents with stridor secondary to laryngeal carcinoma. He has a history of chronic smoking for the past 30 years. Which of the following types of tracheostomy would be indicated in this case?
Which of the following conditions are included in the triad of Behcet disease?

answers.option: Facial paralysis, swelling of lips, and fissured tongue
Dysphagia, iron-deficiency anemia, and esophageal webs
External rectus palsy, retro-orbital pain, and persistent ear discharge.
Mouth ulcers, genital ulcerations, and uveitis

question: Which of the following vertebral levels is the most common site of lodgement of a swallowed foreign body?
Which of the following is true regarding the surface anatomy of the hypopharynx?

answers.option: It has three parts; pre-cricoid region, posterior wall and pyriform fossa
It is the middle part of pharynx
Recurrent laryngeal nerve runs in pyriform fossa
It extends from the hyoid bone to the level of cricoarytenoid joint
It lies opposite the C3-C4 vertebrae

question: Which of the following is the most common presenting feature of glottic cancer?
When performing surgery for mastoiditis, what landmark will be used as the place to start drilling?
